dcterms:creator: A. G. Barto
R. S. Sutton
C. W. Anderson
dcterms:description: The cartpole problem (also known as the inverted pendulum) is a common benchmark in control theory. The goal is to balance a pole to remain upright by horizontally moving the cart. The agent in this environment can take two actions: accelerating the cart left or right.
dcterms:title: Cartpole

dcterms:creator: R. S. Sutton
dcterms:description: The Acrobot is an under-actuated dynamical system where the goal is swinging up a double pendulum using an actuated joint between the two links.
dcterms:title: Acrobot

dcterms:creator: G. Brockman
V. Cheung
L. Pettersson
dcterms:description: The Mountain Car environment is a sparse reward environment where a car is on a one-dimensional track, positioned between two mountains. The goal is to drive up the mountain on the right.
dcterms:title: Mountain Car

dcterms:creator: B. Varga
dcterms:description: Controlled DQN is a dataset related to the implementation of controlled deep Q-learning algorithms.
dcterms:title: Controlled DQN
